text:
To celebrate the birth of her daughter Wyatt, Mila Kunis has teamed up with Gemfields and Marina B to create a ring which honours the devotion and commitment of mothers. The actress, who is also the face of Gemfields, has designed an 18-karat yellow-gold ring set with a Zambian emerald in Marina B’s signature cut, with all profits from the $4,800 (around £2,970) price tag donated to support the upgrade of the Gemfields Nkana Health Centre in Zambia.

“We are very excited about the new Mila ring, as it will introduce the iconic Marina B style to a new generation,” said Paul Lubetsky, the CEO of Marina B. “While we created it for Mila in celebration of Wyatt’s arrival, this is the kind of ring any woman can wear.”

“Having worked with Marina B on a previous collection of emerald jewellery, it was only natural that we would collaborate on a piece for our brand ambassador, Mila Kunis, as she starts her journey into motherhood,” continued Ian Harebottle, the CEO of Gemfields. “Not only is the ring beautiful, but it furthers our commitment to social responsibility.”

Kunis and her fiancé Ashton Kutcher welcomed their first child together, daughter Wyatt Isabelle Kutcher, on 30 September. They confirmed their engagement back in February.

The ‘Mila’ Motherhood ring is available to reserve at marinab.com/mila
title: Mila Kunis Designs for her Daughter

meta_data.description: The actress has partnered with Gemfields to mark the birth of her first child  By Zoe Dickens

og.title: Mila Kunis Designs for her Daughter
